title: ICT-Integrated Project-Based Mathematics Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment designed to strengthen ICT integration competencies linked to mathematics curriculum for pre-service and in-service teachers.

learning_goals: Within a 4-week mid-term course, learners select one real-life workplace problem (e.g., budget analysis, process optimization), perform mathematical modeling and simulation using ICT tools (Excel, Python, etc.), and submit results reports and visualizations.

Learners collect three datasets related to workplace tasks using data analysis apps (Excel, Google Sheets, Datawrapper, etc.) on tablets/smartphones, perform mean/variance/correlation analysis, and generate two types of visualized charts (bar graph, scatter plot) for team sharing.

In a 2-week team project (3–4 members), learners solve three math problems using digital collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Miro, etc.), record the problem-solving process for each via screencast, and achieve ≥4 points (5-point scale) in peer-assessed knowledge-sharing effectiveness.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
